thread.title: LSU miscues linger, with room for error about to disappear | Scout's Take podcast
thread.title_full: LSU miscues linger, with room for error about to disappear | Scout's Take podcast | NOLA.com

author: Jerit Roser, NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune
title: LSU miscues linger, with room for error about to disappear | Scout's Take podcast
text:
Chris Landry pointed out a slew of areas LSU needed to clean up quickly before the degree of difficult picked up relatively soon.
Chris Landry, LandryFootball.com Jerit Roser, NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune And while the NFL scout saw some bright spots from the Tigers during a 44-22 defeat of Eastern Michigan on Saturday, many of those miscues that stood out before the Eagles visited Baton Rouge continued to linger.
Simultaneously, an Oct. 17 matchup with Florida continues to loom larger and larger than expected, shrinking the window during which LSU can more likely enjoy a bit more room for error.
The Tigers host South Carolina — kind of — at 2:30 p.m. this Saturday after a week of uncertainty and a venue change from Columbia, S.C., to Tiger Stadium as a result of the storms and flooding back east.
LSU will now play back-to-back SEC games before hosting Western Kentucky, heading into a bye and then facing four straight conference teams in November.
The Tigers need to make strides quickly in the passing game, on defense, on special teams and in limiting penalties, or could be in trouble before much longer, Landry said.
Check out the podcast below as Landry and NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune writer Jerit Roser discuss the atypical week of preparation, what LSU did well against the Eagles, the growing concerns associated with those miscues and what to expect at 2:30 p.m. Saturday from the Tigers and Gamecocks.
